author: Diario del AltoAragón
title: Vandalismo en Ordesa
text:
Vandalismo en Ordesa
LAS CLAVIJAS de Cotatuero, un símbolo del Parque Nacional de Ordesa y Monte Perdido con 150 años de historia, han sido saboteadas. Y no solo eso, sino que además un ecologista radical -más bien solo esto último- ha grabado la acción y la ha reivindicado en redes sociales como algo ‘heroico’ para “reparar el crimen tan atroz cometido contra la naturaleza de los Pirineos” y “devolver a la naturaleza el santuario de los urogallos y los bucardos”. Por supuesto, la Guardia Civil ha puesto los hechos en conocimiento de la fiscalía y el Gobierno de Aragón interpondrá una denuncia.
La Federación Aragonesa de Montañismo (FAM) condenó el “sabotaje” que califican como “un atentado directo contra el patrimonio común, la seguridad pública y la historia compartida de todos quienes habitan, trabajan y cuidan este entorno”. Por su parte, desde la Fundación para la Conservación del Quebrantahuesos también han condenado la acción. Solo esto último demuestra que la acción nada tiene que ver con la protección de la naturaleza ni con la ecología que, por supuesto, es otra cosa.
Pero, sin entrar en eso, la destrucción de 12 clavijas de una vía mítica en Ordesa es, sin duda, un atentado contra el patrimonio, ya que se instalaron hace 150 años, desde que las colocara por primera vez un herrero de Torla; o al menos, contra el equipamiento público, que además ha puesto en peligro la seguridad de los montañeros. Por ello, el Parque ha tomado la decisión de cerrar todos los pasos y senderos que conducen a este punto, así como que se repondrán las clavijas lo antes posible. El Parque Nacional es un espacio protegido y muy cuidado que no necesita falsos salvadores sino visitantes responsables.

organizations.name: Fundación para la Conservación del Quebrantahuesos

author: Sarah Swain
title: TV host Gavin Morris loves Newcastle so much, he'll never leave - 9Travel
text:
Broadcaster Gavin Morris has﻿ travelled the world.
But the NBN Newcastle host and Today Show summer presenter raves about the stretch of NSW coast where he grew up and now lives.
He resides in the Newcastle, NSW suburb of Merewether﻿ with his partner Sari Jade and daughter Ellie Jade Morris - and says he loves it.
READ MORE: The best things to do in New﻿castle, NSW
Gavin Morris lives in the Newcastle, NSW suburb of Merewether﻿ with partner Sari Jade and daughter Ellie Jade Morris- and says he loves it. (Supplied) "What I Iove is you live in a city, but what you have available to you in 15 minutes is truly extraordinary," he said.
He can often be found on one of the famous long sandy beaches close to his home.
"There's just a variety of conditions you can find along there," he said.
"On the northern end of Bar Beach, at low tide, it is stunning for a young child.
READ MORE: Newcastle's food and drink scene makes it a perfect weekend getaway﻿
Gavin Morris hosting the Today show (Instagram) READ MORE: 'Best place on Earth': Today host Karl Stefanovic's love for holiday spot
"You've got the Mereweather OceanBaths at the other end and these amazing surfing breaks in the middle.
"You can sit on these beaches, particularly Burwood, there's an angle you can sit on the beach and there's no other houses you're looking at national parkland."
He said he has noticed that the city is packed with Sydneysiders these days, either on weekend trips or those who have moved for good.
Four Aussie beaches named in top eight of the world's best View Gallery Morris also regularly makes the short trip for a break at his birthplace, Port Stephens, just a bit further north.
He'll stay at the Ramada Resort by Wyndham Shoal Bay which is right across from the beach, before heading to the﻿ Shoal Bay Country Club﻿ to dine.
He reckons it's a standout spot.﻿
READ MORE: Free mini toiletries to be banned across Europe ﻿
Gavin Morrison heads to Port Stephens were he's from with partner Sari Jade and daughter Ellie Jade Morris. (Supplied) "When I was backpacking around the word, we were sitting at Monaco and the girls were going 'oh look at this' and I was going 'seriously girls do you think this is more beautiful than Port Stephens where we grew up?
"They went 'actually, no!"
Avid traveller﻿ When he was younger, Morris made his way to from Europe to the USA on an old sailing ship.
He went on to work for big broadcasters in New York City and around America.﻿
Dominica, a Caribbean island, is the best place Gavin Morris has ever been. (Getty) And out of all the places he's visited, one Caribbean island stands out.
﻿"One of the most amazing places I had ever seen is an island called Dominica. It hadn't been overrun with tourism,' he said.
He recalled an "incredible walk" he did on the unspoiled island between Guadeloupe and Martinique to the island's Boiling Lake.
It's the second-largest hot lake in the world.
"That's still the most spectacular place on earth that I've ever seen," he said.
READ MORE: Simple trick avid traveller uses to navigate a new city
Gavin Morrison from NBN news lives in Newcastle, NSW. (Destination NSW) Meanwhile Morris wants to get to South America, with flying off the ﻿mountains of Chile in his paraglider on his bucket list.
"It's the last continent outside of Antarctica though I haven't ticked off the list yet," he said.
Gavin Morris' Top spots in Newcastle NSW Cafe: The Paper Run Espresso, 59 Ridge Street Merewether.
"Their smoothies are next level," he says.
Coffee : Akuna Cafe, 40 Patrick St, Merewether.
"Absolutely fabulous coffees."
MoneyPenny is a cocktail bar in Newcastle NSW. (Instagram) Restaurants : Nagisa, 1 Honeysuckle Dr, Newcastle.
"Our favourite by far, it's the most extraordinary Asian," he said.
The Beach Hotel, 99 Frederick St, Merewether.
Scottie's, 36 Scott St, Newcastle East.
Cocktails: MoneyPenny, 1 Honeysuckle Dr, Newcastle, which has "Great cocktails."
﻿Hidden secrets: "The walks are incredible. The Newcastle Memorial Walkway and the Glenrock Reserve, which has incredible mountain biking and walking trails," he said.

author: Reuters
title: Eyenovia atteint un niveau record après l'interruption d'une étude sur un médicament ophtalmologique en phase avancée - 15/11/2024 à 16:10 - Boursorama
text:
((Traduction automatisée par Reuters, veuillez consulter la clause de non-responsabilité https://bit.ly/rtrsauto))
(Mises à jour)
15 novembre - ** Les actions du fabricant de médicaments Eyenovia EYEN.O chutent de69,8 % pour atteindre un niveau record de 10 cents
*les actions du fabricant de médicaments Eyenovia <YENEN OO> chutent de 69,8 % pour atteindre un creux de 10 cents * La société interrompt une étude de stade avancé pour sa combinaison expérimentale de médicament et d'appareil après avoir échoué à l'objectif principal de ralentir la progression de la maladie
** La société testait le médicament pour traiter la myopie progressive pédiatrique qui provoque une myopie dans la petite enfance, qui s'aggrave au fur et à mesure que la personne grandit
** Un comité indépendant a examiné les données de sécurité et d'efficacité de 252 participants à l'essai et a constaté que le taux de progression de la myopie n'était pas significativement différent entre le groupe de traitement et le placebo
** Nous prévoyons de mettre fin à l'étude, d'examiner les données de manière plus approfondie et d'évaluer les prochaines étapes" - EYEN
** L'entreprise déclare qu'elle évalue ses options stratégiques, qui peuvent inclure un regroupement d'entreprises, une fusion inversée, des ventes d'actifs ou une combinaison de ces alternatives
** Compte tenu des résultats négatifs et des contraintes de capital de la société, nous rétrogradons les actions d'Eyenovia à Market Perform" - courtier William Blair
** En tenant compte des mouvements de la séance, l'action a baissé de 94,8 % depuis le début de l'année
